heading: trés retro
subheading: fouquet's, the venerable parisian restaurant on the champs elysees, turns 100 this month and it kind of feels like 1899 around the place right now. management has reinstated its old policy of barring single women, responding, it says, to the proliferation of pimps, dealers, hookers, and other "undesirables." so tough luck, sniffs yvan lavaux, fouquet's director. "in order to improve the image ... we no longer accept non-accompanied ladies in the brasserie area. except, of course, clients whom we frequently see with their husbands."
